title: Thin film - thickness and lambda - air-film-glass

content.question:
Two different thin films, Film <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Film <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, coat the surfaces of two glass blocks. Green, monochromatic light from the same light source is incident on each film-glass combination, as shown in the figure. Films <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> have refractive indexes of <math alttext="1.40" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.40</mn></math> and <math alttext="1.60" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.60</mn></math>, respectively, and the glass has a refractive index of <math alttext="1.50" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.50</mn></math>. Each film has the minimum nonzero thickness required for maximum destructive interference between the light reflected from the air-film and film-glass interfaces. Which of the following correctly compares the thicknesses of the two films as well as the wavelength of the green light within the two film materials?
